bug.author: wooksong
bug.summary: [Converter] Memory leak occurs unless using 4xN width for input streams.
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Issue Description</denchmark-h>
Unless 4xN width is used for input streams, memory leak occurs. <denchmark-h:h1>How to Reproduce</denchmark-h>
gst-launch-1.0 videotestsrc ! video/x-raw,width=1921,height=1080,format=RGB ! tensor_converter ! tensor_sink Here is how 'MemFree' of '/proc/meminfo' is changed after running above command. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2772376/47771696-a36b9580-dd27-11e8-8bdc-2955f90fb71e.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h1>Expected Result</denchmark-h>
If 4xN width is used for input streams, nothing goes wrong. gst-launch-1.0 videotestsrc ! video/x-raw,width=1920,height=1080,format=RGB ! tensor_converter ! tensor_sink <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2772376/47772013-a87d1480-dd28-11e8-95c8-cac0a27dae78.png></denchmark-link>

comments.comment: : Thank you for posting issue <denchmark-link:https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer/issues/735>#735</denchmark-link> . The person in charge will reply soon.

it needs gst_buffer_unref in gst_tensor_converter_chain function when,
video (remove padding, width % 4 > 0) string (in-buffer size != 1024)
PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer/pull/736>#736</denchmark-link> added code to unref old buffer.
IMO, this issue is fixed now.
